oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The New Christian Church, circa 1859
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A page from a mounted and bound volume of twenty-five pen-and-ink wash drawings, and two pen-and-ink maps of Nashville created by William A. Eichbaum during the 1850s. Eichbaum was a Nashville bookseller and resident for fifty years. This drawing is of the new Christian Church, built in the early 1850s to replace the old Christian Church. This new structure was built on Cherry Street (now Fourth Avenue). A broad flight of stairs led to the portico, supported by four massive fluted columns. Special features included a belfry and a spire measuring 150 feet high. This church burned in a fire in 1857, forcing the congregation to return to the old Christian Church building on Spring Street (now Church Street). A new building on Vine Street was completed in 1889, giving the church its current name, Vine Street Church of Christ. In the mid 1950s the Vine Street Church was razed to make way for a parking lot. The church then relocated to Harding Road. Forms part of the William A. Eichbaum Sketchbook. 1 drawing : col. ; 5.75 x 9 in.
